title: Treat Hypothermia Through Controlled Rewarming
brief: Safely rewarm a hypothermia victim using proper techniques to avoid cardiac complications.
steps: Step 1: If warm water available, immerse only the trunk area in water heated to 37.7-43.3°C (100-110°F).
Step 2: For field treatment, wrap victim in warmed sleeping bag with another warm, naked person (both naked).
Step 3: If conscious, give hot sweetened fluids - honey or dextrose preferred, sugar or cocoa acceptable.
Step 4: Focus warming efforts on the core area while stimulating peripheral circulation.
Step 5: Monitor for 'after drop' - sharp temperature decline when moving victim from warm treatment.
warnings: Never do total body rewarming in warm water bath outside hospital - increases risk of cardiac arrest.
Do not force unconscious person to drink fluids.
Rewarming too rapidly can cause circulatory problems and heart failure.
The person helping in sleeping bag can also become hypothermic if left too long.
